citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS)
citeinfo.title: Alaska Marine Species List - Alaska Sea Grant Radio Show

descript.abstract: Alaska's coast is home to hundreds of marine plants, fish and animals. Biologist Brad Stevens should know. He's personally counted them. Doug Schneider has more in this week's Arctic Science Journeys Radio.
descript.purpose: So far, Brad Stevens' list totals more than 750 species of crabs, fish, plants, and marine mammals everything from the quarter-sized fuzzy crab to the one-ton Steller sea lion. Stevens is a crab biologist with the National Marine Fisheries Service in Kodiak, Alaska. He started the list more than a decade ago.
